key_points: Joe Biden was sworn in as the 46th president of the United States, facing a combination of crises.
The inauguration ceremony was held with strict COVID-19 protocols, reflecting the ongoing pandemic and heightened security measures.
Kamala Harris made history as the first female vice president and the first person of Black and South Asian descent to hold the office.
Biden's inaugural address emphasized unity, democracy, and overcoming challenges together as a nation.
The ceremony took place in a heavily fortified U.S. Capitol, just weeks after a violent assault on the building.
Biden called on Americans to end the 'uncivil war' that has fractured the country.
The inauguration was attended by a small, socially distanced audience.
Vice President Kamala Harris broke several barriers with her inauguration, highlighting the diversity in American politics.
Biden highlighted the importance of democracy and its resilience in facing tests.
Donald Trump left office Wednesday morning, making way for Joe Biden as the new president.
